## Read 

```{r}
#| label: read-tracking

library(glue)
library(tidyverse)

tracking0 <- read_tsv(
  file="../data/tracking.txt",
  col_types="cncnnnn",
  col_names=TRUE)
names(tracking0) <- tolower(names(tracking0))

glimpse(tracking0)
```
::: notes
https://gksmyth.github.io/ozdasl/general/tracking.html
https://gksmyth.github.io/ozdasl/general/tracking.txt
:::

## Create Child variable

```{r}
#| label: create-child

tracking0 |>
  mutate(child =case_when(
    age <= 18 ~ "yes",
    age > 18 ~ "no")) -> tracking1
```

## Descriptive statistics for sex

```{r}
#| label: sex-counts

tracking1 |>
  count(sex) |>
  mutate(total=sum(n)) |>
  mutate(pct=round(100*n/total)) |>
  mutate(pct=glue("{pct}% ({n}/{total})")) |>
  select(-n, -total)
```

#### Interpretatipon of the output

Males comprise 62% of the sample

## Descriptive statistics for child

```{r}
#| label: child-counts

tracking1 |>
  count(child) |>
  mutate(total=sum(n)) |>
  mutate(pct=round(100*n/total)) |>
  mutate(pct=glue("{pct}% ({n}/{total})")) |>
  select(-n, -total)
```

#### Interpretation of the output

Children (18 and younger) comprise 56% of the sample.

## Descriptive statistics for shape

```{r}
#| label: shape-counts

tracking1 |>
  count(shape) |>
  mutate(total=sum(n)) |>
  mutate(pct=round(100*n/total)) |>
  mutate(pct=glue("{pct}% ({n}/{total})")) |>
  select(-n, -total)

```

#### Interpretation of the output

Boxes were used as tracking symbols in 70% of the trials.

## Descriptive statistics for trial4

```{r}
#| label: trial4-mean

tracking1 |>
  summarize(
    trial4_mean=mean(trial4),
    trial4_sd=sd(trial4),
    trial4_min=min(trial4),
    trial4_max=max(trial4))
```

#### Interpretation of the output

The tracking task lasted for 15 seconds, so the average time is quite low. There is a wide range of variation, with one subject tracking for more than 11 seconds out of 15.

## Boxplots

```{r}
#| label: trial4-boxplots
#| fig-wdith: 8
#| fig.height: 2

tracking1 |>
  ggplot() +
  aes(
    x=trial4,
    y=child,
    color=sex) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  labs(
    x="Tracking time (seconds)",
    y="Child",
    caption="Simon, 2026-02-05")
```

#### Interpretation of the output
